oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have a separate version of these laws or sayings of the Anteater and Lynx. (L I.–2. 138–150.) Accounting for the habits of animals, in which various animals marry their own kind, eat certain things and behave in certain ways, because the Anteater tells them to.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Anteater's laws (|a!kunta's version)
